Instrument.name: The Ulysses Dust Detection System (UDDS)
Instrument.description: The instrument Ulysses Dust Detection System (UDDS) consisted of a 0.1 mm thick gold foil of hemispherical shape with three grids at the entrance (entrance grid, charge grid, and shield), as well as an ion collector and channeltron detector. The maximum sensitive area (for particles moving parallel to the sensor axis) was 0.1 m**2. Upon impact the particle produced a plasma, whose charge carriers were separated by an electric field between the target and the ion collector. Negative charges (mainly electrons) were collected at the target. The positive charges were collected partly by the ion collector and partly by a channeltron. The channeltron was used as it was insensitive to electric and vibrational noise.
